Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following information in the past 24 months: -
- any correspondence between Museums Sheffield and Libraries Sheffield / Sheffield City Council regarding the renovation of the Central Library building.
- any reports commissioned by the council on the state of the current central library buildings and / or to gain an estimate for renovation of the central library building.
Yours faithfully,
Matt Smith

Dear Matt Smith,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Central Library
which we received on 16/11/2022.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
Please be aware that Sheffield City Council’s response to the global
COVID-19 pandemic has led to a reduction in resources across the Council,
meaning that we are currently dealing with a backlog of requests.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 14/12/2022, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Matt Smith
We apologise for the delay in responding to your request of 16 November
2022 (due on 14 December 2022) and the internal review of 5 June 2023 due
on 3 July 2023, for information about the renovations of the central
library. I uphold your complaint about our delay, which is a breach of the
Code of Practice for Environmental Information Regulations 2004, which
requires a response to a request for information within 20 days and
internal review within 40 working days.
There were two aspects to your request:
- any correspondence between Museums Sheffield and Libraries Sheffield /
Sheffield City Council regarding the renovation of the Central Library
building.
Our Library service cannot locate any information on any renovations or
repairs relating to the Central Library in the two years prior to your
request with Museums Sheffield or Facilities Management. The building and
its maintenance fall under the remit of Facilities Management.
- any reports commissioned by the council on the state of the current
central library buildings and / or to gain an estimate for renovation of
the central library building.
We are sending you 12 reports in four batches due to size.
Please note the names of third parties and the names of some staff members
have been redacted under Regulation 12(3) of the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13 EIR as amended by Sch. 19, para
307 of the Data Protection Act 2018, which provide an exception for where
the information requested includes personal data of which the applicant is
not the data subject, where disclosure would contravene the data
protection principles of the UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Disclosure of the information would contravene the data protection
principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation
that processing of personal data must be lawful, fair and transparent.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
